case.state: So... this is what we're playing at the campfire, then? Are we sure this isn't a trial?
Time for some well-needed R+R.
A pleasure.
A perfect way to get some time away from the "office."
I wasn't expecting this to turn into a trial... But good to see you, ~name~.
Nice to see you, ~name~. Is this going to be a trial, or something more... uh... like the earlier parts of a horror movie?
I see the conventional way of hooking survivors wasn't enough, was it, ~name~?
Fuck. Is this some new twisted game for you, ~name~?
...Usually, when it comes to a zombie like ~name~, there's more of a gunfight than a card game. Not sure how I feel about this.
Well. As long as ~name~ isn't going to start trying to bite anyone or mutate into something way less cute, I guess we can just focus on the game...?
Mommy? You're going to have to try a little harder. Winters would go nuts if he heard you use that name.
Ahahaha--! You're serious? Well all right then, Mommy.
Well. If I'm going to call you Mama, you gotta show me I've been a good boy, don't you think?
Hey, you're one hot mama either way, Mommy.
I thought it was just the jetski ride and the explosions, but you were completely serious, weren't you, Ash?
When you brought up the overtime thing, you weren't kidding.
I've known a few Ashleys. Kind of like the president's daughter type more than the boomstick and mettle of man type.
Ashley's either a name for a politician's daughter or a dandy. I guess it's dandy to have you here, Ash.
...Looking to be a different kind of sandwich, Jill?
Jill, I never took you for a sandwich-liker.
Claire's great, Chris, but we're just friends.
Bro, if you want to continue the bloodline so bad, why don't you get a girlfriend?
Okay, Daddy it is. I'm more into the acid rock stuff than beatniks, but whatever floats your boat.
I'm more of a grunge enjoyer, but okay, Daddy-o.
Well. Claire, gotta say, you could've just asked me out. I just never wanted to assume you were actually interested.
Oh uh... Claire. I thought it was a joke this whole time... I guess not.
Look, man. I deal with megalomaniacs professionally. Let's play, but I'm not calling you that.
No way, man. Enough with the psycho domineering shit. We can play, but I'll call you something else.
Good to see you, Cheryl. Or is it Heather, today? Biohazards and curses aren't going to stop us tonight. ...Right?
Good to see you, Heather. Or is it Cheryl today? Biohazards and curses aren't going to stop us tonight. ...Right?
Ada? O-oh. My mistake. Just thought you looked like... someone I know.
Ada? Oh... Uh... must be a common name.
...Guess Ada Wong's a pretty common name. Or a pretty fake one...
...I'm fine being outnumbered by Bioweapons, but this is rich.
My one night off, and I'm still fighting zombies and worse. Fine.
I don't mind being a bodyguard, but you know I came here to play, right? Uh...
Hm. It's not like Ashley wasn't cute, but the boss's daughter, after a mission to save her? Not cool, bro.
Sigh. High school Leon'd be jealous right now, Didn't sign up to be a babysitter. Tonight, anyway.
You travel as much as I do, and a game of cards is a bit like stepping back home. Name's Leon.
This is a mission I think I'm going like. I'm Leon Kennedy. Agent.
Finally. Something straightforward. I'm Leon. Good to play with you.
~Cards.text~ for me, please.
~Cards.text~. Not my favorite part of the game.
It's going to be like this, huh?
Dealer, I'll swap ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~, dealer.
Huh.
It's a start. ~Cards.text~.
Not bad. ~Cards.text~.
~Cards.text~.
Nice to hit an ammo dump, even if it'll get harder from here.
There we go.
I'm a regular master of poker.
No way, man.
Hey, looks like I got lucky, and we're just getting started.
I'd offer to hand it to you, but I'm used to keeping my own inventory. And this is good stuff.
Nice. It's not always what you find, but how you can put it together.
Still in it.
Damn. Well, always carry a backup weapon. You'd be surprised how quickly a situation can turn... rough.
Okay. Not really much of a tactical play that can be made here, but I'm not doomed, yet.
I don't have much of a poker face. But I'm pretty good at oneliners.
Everyone doing alright?
I think the stakes here are just right.
Not too bad. The view or the cards.
Okay. Let's get to it.
Well, not a lot left in the clip on that one?
I'm a never-say-die kind of man. Both because optimism is important and because few things ever really stay down when I'm involved.
A challenge just makes winning better. I'm just lucky like that, I guess.
Well, come on then. Take a look.
Damn.
Ah, damn. Bad news for me. But, I'm more an action guy than a sit and read one.
Getting dealt bad hands is just a way of life for me. Why worry?
I like that you're neatly trimmed like that. Your hair's so bright... uh, in the upstairs, that to see it a little darker below seems... naughty and thematic, right?
Can't say that I do, Tao. They'd sure come in handy.
I specialize in dealing with terrorist threats, particularly those employing bio-organic weapons. If it sounds like a bad dream, trust me, reality is worse. Zombies, mutants, that sort of thing.
Have any of you heard the term "BOW"? You will if you keep me talking, but it means "bio-organic weapon." A monster, made by infecting humans, or grown in a vat.
People and bioweapons carry the weirdest things.
You know, lots of rookies are always popping their clips out to reload after a shot or two. They do realize they have to reload the clip too, right?
I've gotten pretty good at cooking eggs. Spent a lot of time eating them in Eastern Europe.
Hm. This isn't a setup, is it? ...I wonder if it's better to just ask someone to get naked, or if a game makes it a bit easier?
(I wonder if Ada's ever played something like this...)
Are there any house rules here? I'm pretty good at figuring out a situation on the fly if I know what I'm working with. Or if I don't.
I'm glad it's really just poker. Reading scribbled notes on mad science and cultic gibberish gets old and cryptic after a while.
A single pair is pretty much the most common thing you can expect, right? ...Well, I suppose you'll see pairs of lots of things in a game like this.
Call me old-fashioned, but I enjoy a good typewriter over an email or GSM where I can find one. Less risk of a signal being hijacked by some psycho.
Kind of a mixed bag tonight. Anyone here happen to know if they sell ink ribbons here? I guess the price of obscure interests is more than just money.
Apparently there's this movie about another guy named Leon. Everyone always asks me if I'm being professional. And I'm nothing but, you know?
I've heard and said a few bad pickup lines in my time. But "Hey girl, are you a zombie? Because I want you to bite me" is probably the worst.
It takes all types, right? Some of us use our brains, some of us just punch boulders.
Why do people always overcomplicate things? You should be able to press a button to open a door, like a reasonable person. Not backtrack to the basement for a cat statue or whatever.
Drawing things out with lots of accessories or taking off something big in two parts isn't a bad idea. Instant gratification is overrated. Maybe I'm just a masochist.
The best asset's the mind. A sharp one can be all you need to make it through the night.
I could really use a back massage. I usually carry around a lot of gear, even if it's pretty well organized.
If you focus and think for a second, it can save a round of ammo or even your life.Most people'd rather die than think, I guess.
It's pretty lucky that most guns use similar types of ammo. It would be a shame to get deep cover only to find your weapons are useless.
I've gotten a lot of use out of that toxicology class I took at the academy. Herbs that give you a bit of pep might wear off in a day or two, but damned if that isn't life or death.
I wonder if there's some kind of knife that has a gun with it? Not like a bayonet, but something you can use to fire off a round in the squall of melee...
Anyone a wrestler? I've got a pretty mean suplex and power bomb. Even taught the president's daughter.
...Something on your mind, Rosa?
The spooky shit works a lot better on someone who doesn't actually deal with those sorts of things, Hu Tao.
Hu Tao, that's creepy, but it's a better line on macho types who've never seen a corpse lunge around a corner at them.
You're cute so I can put up with another minute or two of this, but ghosts aren't real. BOW's are.
BOWs exist. Ghosts don't. You're really doubling down on this schtick, but that's a bad bet for the game.
I was wrong, I guess. Ghosts are real, just not in my world. I deal with... I guess you'd call them mutants, or undead, but they're not alive how you or I would think of them. Those are BOWs.
Nope. Ghosts are still new to me. Most of the things I have to fight were alive at one point, then got mutated into something worse. We call them BOWs.
I find shooting them in the head or lighting them on fire does a lot. Or you can blow them up.
I don't mean to make it sound easy, but a heavy blow to the head, incineration... freezing them, blowing them up... lots of options.
That's about right. I was there during the first big outbreak, in Raccoon City. First day on the force. Only one that made it out.
I was there in Raccoon City, just a day late enough to avoid getting caught when the first BOWs really came out in force. First day on the job, and last.
Besides the evolving ways in which people are trying to kill or control each other, it's nice.
It's generally a nice place, but people are always finding new ways to kill each other.
I could use some help, but... I'm not sure I need it with the undead at this point, Tao...
Tao, at this stage, I could use a bit of other support.
Hey, one of us has to be equipped to handle problems. If you want to find me in a difficult position, save it for when the game's wrapped up...
You're making that a really difficult proposition. If we had to deal with a BOW, you'd be able to take care of that first, right?
N-not often.
Y-you're... uh... quite a bit prettier, Tao...
Not all of us having flaming butterflies on command. I've got to use bullets, and those run out. And I can't get too tired.
I wish it were that easy. I've got to keep my attention together, not get too hurt, and not run out of shells, Tao.
With an entrance like that, what choice does a guy have, Petra? Yeah, I routinely fight terrorists and bio-organic weapons.
I guess this is a good place to talk shop, Petra. I'm mostly on call to deal with terrorists, bio-organic weapons, and monsters of both varieites.
I'm more of a cop than a knight... but I'll take the compliment, Barbara...
A knight...? Well, that's one hell of a compliment.
Uh... okay then, Aaravi.
I wasn't planning on it...
Heh. Less for zombies to grab onto. Or roots, or other appendages. I'm great at puzzles, I'll have you know.
Not big into video games, but I don't doubt it. Surviving a night of horrors... well, you don't get to press start and continue if you die.
Interpol? Well, those're the guys that call me in.
Heh. Interpol? I like those guys, but they usually call me in.
A bit of everything. Some bodyguard work, some escort missions, counter-terrorism...
Yeesh. I thought Earth needing the BSAA was bad. To have a whole order of knights to fight zombies and stuff? That's pretty awful, Lux.
Sentinels of Light? If they're anything like the BSAA, probably for the best. I wouldn't consider myself a hunter as much as an agent, though.
You're welcome to call me Leon, and everyone's got to burn daylight somehow. Guess for you, that might be a bit more literal, Lux.
Everyone's got a day job, right, Lux? I guess yours is a little bit more "day" than mine. You can call me Leon, by the way.
I'm sure I've said I'm resourceful. But I'll play fair tonight.
Not bad.
Hate to squeeze another layer out, but the ~background.surface~ doesn't look so bad tonight.
Well, the ~background.surface~ doesn't look too bad.
I won't get to reload, but I'm not out of ammo.
I can still fire a payload without these.
Don't get me wrong, I trust most of you, but I think I'll keep my gun a bit longer.
I guess at this stage, my jacket's the right choice...
Come on, someone's got to have wanted to see this.
I know there's not much left to imagine, but this's doing it for one of you, right?
The jeans and abs not doing it for you? Well, okay then.
Hey, I'm no model, but if this look isn't doing it for you, I can always show off more.
About now, this is a prize for both of us, right?
Well, time to pull out all the stops. Or pull myself out, at least.
Close call, but still early.
Not bad, everyone. But I've got plenty of time.
Well then. No need to speed up, given how close it is.
If you can't tell, I'm not in a hurry. There's a time in a place, and I want to enjoy this.
Sometimes you gotta trade in. I'd rather keep playing than keep looking this good.
Have to say. If I'm going to undress, here's a lot better than coming to in some lab or basement somewhere.
This is what I'm talking about! Just enough to feel in the game, not so much or so little that it feels too easy or too hard. Don't go calling me Goldilocks yet though.
Call me a workaholic, but I like this feeling of being balanced on a razor's edge. Or maybe I'm just not a fan of beards.
Not the type of guy that tans, so, don't get blinded.
I'd drop a flashbang, but I think I'm pretty pale as is.
Whatever it takes to get us all out of the game, right?
You didn't catch me with my pants down. Just part of the plan.
In my career, you get to see a lot of bad people in otherwise pretty good places.
Can't say I've seen the best life has to offer. But despite all the bad, there's plenty of good, too.
Not bad. Not sure if you distracted me, or just bad luck, but it keeps this interesting.
I'm used to scraping together an escape plan from bad luck and sketchy intel. This'll keep it interesting, even if it's a ~background.time~ off for me.
Well damn. I've played cards in dozens of countries, and met some real sharks. But not a great showing for Mr. Kennedy tonight.
Jeez. I'm happy to do it, but buy a guy dinner or a beer first.
Can't say I like losing, but there's worse positions to be in.
Ah. Well, you get used to difficult situations.
...Damn it.
...Well, shit. I better get it together.
I can turn this around. But I gotta rely on you being distracted.
I'm not exactly bench pressing cars, but I'm in good shape. Hopefully that's as much leverage as I need to turn this around.
Win some, lose some. Nothing breathing down my neck here. At least not in the awful ways things usually do.
Probably could've stocked up a bit before coming here tonight. But, hey, even if I lose, not like I'm gonna die.
Down, but definitely not done yet.
Well, wish I had a secret weapon, but this one's no secret, right?
Not quite sure I get it, but you've got my attention, Rosa.
Heh. Not bad, Rosa.
Racoon City... Los Illuminados... yeah. Not to say I'm some kind of icy badass, but a few ghouls are more of an occupational hazard at this point.
I've seen a few things. Zombies, bioweapons, parasites. Monsters in all shapes. I need more than a living corpse to scare me.
It's pretty fucked, but zombies are pretty simple. It's the giant mutants, with their claws and extra eyes and tentacles and... That's the kinda shit that keeps me up at night.
It's because they're so rare that they're a problem. And it's not like a spooky story where someone's back from the dead for vengeance... usually.
Not a fan of horror stories, if you can't tell. Most of the time someone comes back from the dead, it's that they weren't finished off. Zombies are rare.
If your Vision weren't functioning, I'd always protect you.
If... That Vision of yours weren't functioning, I could take care of you.
Just because you're losing so badly doesn't give you the right to tease me, Hu Tao...
You better not just be teasing me because you lost so badly...
True... but... I think my feelings are a little different given that you're...
You're... definitely a lot more interesting and less... like I want to...
...Most of the time, the dead stay put. But... I'm the person that gets called when they don't.
It might be normal for you, but it's a pretty bad sign in my world when I get called in, Tao. It's not normal for us. At all.
Learning from the master, huh? Can't complain if it's you.
You're a bit busy... but I'd appreciate the help. I'm as much of an expert as any of us.
A BOW is a bio-organic weapon. It's what happens when a virus is used to turn living tissue into something else. Like a mindless, flesh-eating zombie.
Zombies are a type of BOW. A bio-organic weapon that manipulates flesh into something awful. They're a lot more likely to kill you than a campfire story.
What about you? How do you deal with it? Or are you just going to tell me a scary story?
What's your method? You've probably been doing it longer, so go on, teach me. Or you can tell me another spooky story.
Shutguns and handguns are my preferred weapons of choice... but I can use a dagger or longarm, too.
A bow or dagger... Hm. I'm pretty good with a knife, but I prefer handguns or shotguns.
Must be nice. Aren't "adventurers" supposed to at least look out for innocent people? Sometimes people just want a normal job, and to help people at the end of the day.
Yeah, Ravi, that all sounds real freshman year, and I'm sure you're really impressed with yourself.
Overlapping stained glass, power-balancing, so on and so on... yeah, a real Tuesday for me, Ravi.
Most of them involve dealing with outbreaks of bio-organic weapons.
It stands for "Bioterrorism Security Assessment Alliance." It's a paramilitary group, so it operates independently of any country.
I do some work for the Bioterrorism Security Assessment Alliance. But they're not involved with any nation, specifically.
Dunno about you, but this kind of thing is fun. I play a lot of cards. I read. Enjoy a beer or two. What about you?
Just my shoes for now, so chatting a bit seems like fun to me. I tend to read between missions, and I like a drink and some cards.
Lux, Leon is fine. I'm not a knight in shining armor.
Leon is fine, Lux. I may not be a knight, but...
...Aaravi, do you want me to pick you up? Is that what you're into? I won't do it if you don't ask, and even then, but...
I feel safe here. No music or typewriter, but hey, nothing trying to dismember or infect me, either.
No real risk of getting hurt, right? Well, nothing a quick first aid spray can't fix.
A good pair of boots sticks with you in rain, mud, ice, and gore.
You never know what kind of gross effluvium you'll find yourself traipsing through in my line of work. So, good boots are a must.
Well, not a lot of sense in looking the part if I can't do it.
Gun, holster, belt, bandolier. There we go.
My first day on the job, the entire city fell to a zombie plague... not really a happy moment, but just so you know what I've been dealing with for years.
I'd say I've got more spirit than luck. As a rookie, my first day on the job was in Raccoon City. All you need to know is it was like a horror movie.
Never underestimate the power of blinding.
Hey, I work hard. May as well let some of you enjoy it.
What can I say, I'm full of surprises.
Not part of the usual script, but real life's not a movie.
Hoping for a last minute save, here...
Just as things start to come to a close, usually that's when the best weapons start to show up.
If it's a scary story you want, just buy me a beer first, Hu Tao.
If you want to use a line on me, go ahead, but I like it better when there's a drink involved.
You didn't strike me as a cheap date... Why don't we see how the rest of the game goes, Hu Tao?
We can talk shop all you like after the game. But for now, let's focus on living and less on making dead things stay that way.
Well... You could always take me out for dinner. I... I'd love to do that with you.
You could teach me how to use that Vision of yours... or one for myself? But... you can take me out for dinner, if that's easiest...
...I'm honestly not sure what to do here. You're... well, why me, Tao?
Tao, why me? Honestly, I'm used to this being part of the joke, and I don't like being a punchline...
Well... If you;re interested... I can't say I'd mind.
Well... you're going to have have to give me something pretty tempting to make my way over to you. But... I'm almost there.
I've got a bit of a crush on you... and... well. If that number was just you... I'd be happy about that.
If they were human, or an animal, they're certainly like nothing living. Nothing natural. And it shouldn't exist, regardless.
It can be both, but none of them look like anything that ought to exist in the world.
What are you talking about? I can't... do that. Just snap my fingers and make fire appear? Gotta have a grenade or something.
...Yeah, about that? Just snapping your fingers "whoosh, fire"? Well... it runs out, right? My stuff usually does, so color me jealous.
Well, gotta do what you gotta do. Got as many people out as I could, too. It's why I always wanted to be a cop, even if what I do now's different.
I never thought I'd be fighting off horrible monsters. Just a criminal or two. But I get as many people out as I can.
I have my gun with me, at my side. It's... it's like if a bow drew and fired itself, but the missles are a lot smaller, and higher impact. They're instrumental in dealing with modern problems.
The silver thing at my side is a gun. And... they're pretty instrumental in dealing with modern threats. They're easier to use and hit a lot harder than a bow.
Oh you're totally thinking of bouncing on whatever I've got packed away under these pants, but I'll play alnog.
You're worth saving, at least a dozen times over. I'm... well. I guess you'd call it a crush.
I think you're cute, but you're... you're something special, too.
A lot easier with an expert. Plus, that Vision of yours ought to come in handy. But... if we clear out all those problems, what will we do with the rest of the time.
All I'm worried about is with all the problems solved, we'll have too much time on our hands. Especially if I get my hands on one of those Visions you've brought up.
Ravi, if you're still puzzling on how to make people like you, cool it with the competition.
The only thing that's puzzling to me is why you think talking to people like this is endearing, Ravi.
Good for you that you're hot shit. I don't have magic, or special training. I just have to use my brains and get lucky. And if I fuck up, other people die.
I work directly for the American government, but BSAA're good people. Your Sentinels must have their work cut out for them.
Glad to see someone's trying to keep the world safe for you, too. As for me, I work more for my nation than something like that, though.
You seem a bit new to this kind of thing. Having a good time, right?
As long as you're having a good time, I'm game. But I can see you having a good time at a tavern or bar, too.
But glad to see you're waving a banner for me, anyway.
Leon's a lot easier to say in the heat of the moment, anyway.
I'm sure you'll find someone who'll be happy to help you with that, Aaravi.
...Anyway. I'd keep my gloves for a bit later, but I want you to work for my jacket. Damn thing seems to always get lost first. Plus, not like anyone wants me to keep them.
Jacket's lowkey, stylish, and durable. Sadly, always gets lost first, though, and I'm not handling any kind of tool that wouldn't prefer bare hands tonight, anyway.
Not to be grim, but having a normal night out with all of you is a bit of an adjustment.
Strip poker's a lot easier than being worried about your flesh being stripped. But uh, kind of hard for me to just leave the office.
But hey, if you want to knock them, that's what we're all here for?
A bit weird to take them off, but hey, I'm full of surprises.
Sometimes, you gotta travel light. Usually good to keep the chamber loaded, but I kept my ammo in the locker today.
Hey, disarmed isn't the same as unarmed. I've got plenty of spunk left in me.
But hey, not bad, right? Take a nice long look.
I lost, so go ahead and enjoy the view.
Why settle for boxers or briefs, when you can have both? Important assets require delicate support.
The benefits of both worlds. The package is kept secure, and mobile.
...Given enough time to reload, I've got infinite ammo, too. And I hear each shot's not too bad, either.
...Not quite a rocket launcher, but it's a lot better for delicate work.
We can swap stories if you want. Or we can get right down to it.
Undress to impress, ~name~.
It's a little better if we share ammo, don't you think, ~name~?
Whoa. Uh. ~Name~, mind... really experimenting with mixed components?
If you're feeling burned, just slap some green herbs on that.
Had to be you eventually, ~name~.
Don't show the rest of us up just yet, ~name~.
Not normally my style, but I'm a function-over-form type of guy.
Hey handsome, save some good looks for the rest of us.
Team effort, right, ~name~?
Focus on the mission, ~name~. At least the objective is fun.
Let's take a look at your loadout.
Normally, I'm telling people to keep it together. But feel free to lose it a bit.
Huh. I've known a few handsome men, but I guess the context here is a little different...
Ah, it's ~name~. Not to say I'm an old man, but this always feels a bit conflicting.
Nothing wrong with you, ~name~, just have complex thoughts about this.
You're pretty cute, but I feel like I should be protecting you.
Love it when a woman brings her own protection.
Nice guns. Your other ballistics aren't half bad either.
Normally I'm the one doing the shooting, but I love a woman who knows her way around a range.
Things are going good to great over here.
I'm on the ropes over here. Mind giving me a chance to save?
Lady, you got me pegged.
All right, now we're in business.
I've got good trigger discipline, ~name~, but I don't mind you throwing a challenge my way.
Don't think you'd believe me if I said I wasn't looking forward to this.
I can't take my eyes off you.
I got your back.
You're in safe hands.
Take it from me, losing a jacket or whatever just makes you look more badass later.
Don't worry, I have my eyes on you.
This place is generally safe, but I'll make sure you're not compromised, ~name~.
I'm not ready to say mission accomplished just yet, but no unexpected troubles yet.
You go ahead and handle this one, ~name~.
You're dressed for the role, ~name~. If you need me to rescue you, hey, that's what I do.
I've known a fair share of impressive women, but you've got my attention.
Take it easy on us poor guys, ~name~.
Huh. Okay, lost focus for a second, there.
Asking what could go wrong is kind of a pointless exercise. You just enjoy the little save points, and keep going until you save the day.
Don't get spooked now, ~name~.
Not that this is a great first date, but it's got all the parts of one, right?
...So, what's your plan for after this?
Huh. I almost feel like this should be more interesting than nobody losing...
It feels a bit boring that we do nothing instead of celebrating this rare event...
Oh come on, nothing? It's such a rare thing! Some of us are trying to jerk off... give me something good!
...Not to mix work and pleasure, but that's like a grenade: single use, small, impactful. ...Might flash people.
Rub it in, all right.
Hm. Sexy is sexy, I guess. Small time ~clothing.ifPlural(~clothing~|~clothing~s)~, big time lesson.
Small, but if you didn't need it, you wouldn't use it, right?
Just a bit like tossing the box after you take the ammo.
Not filling the attache case with that.
If you've got extra stock, toss some my way.
I'd say good things come in small packages, but I've never met a problem that couldn't be solved with a rocket.
I'm used to lulls in the action. You almost learn to appreciate them.
...On second thought, go right ahead.
Ha-- you must feel pretty good. Not every day I get to enjoy a man's ~clothing~ so much.
I'm used to finishing something off with reserve ammo. Tables are turned, huh?
Just routine intelligence gathering.
Good to pace yourself. You can't make it to the end if you fire off all at once.
I'm just grateful for a break in the action. The shamblers are always more common than the big ones.
On the other hand, it's always a chess piece or a gemstone that opens the way forward.
...Nice utility, though.
Hey, enjoy it. If you didn't need that, you wouldn't have brought it, right?
Can't let your guard down for a second in a game like this.
I've survived worse, you'll be fine.
May as well take your time, not really raising alarms here.
Never know when that'll come in handy again, right?
Women always get to pick functional and appealing accessories. Men just have to settle for black or brown.
Stay sharp.
Not feeling drafty, are you?
This is the part you tell us that your ~clothing~~clothing.ifPlural('re|'s)~ part of some obscure passcode or mechanism, right?
I could joke about your ~clothing~, but use it if you got it.
Your ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(were|was)~ really holding the outfit together.
All clear.
Big things ahead.
Smart.
Hey, when you work in obscure parts of the world, you take what you can get.
Kind of hard to appreciate a puzzle when you just wanna see the other side of it, ~name~.
Keeping it interesting, huh?
What can I say? I like a woman who can kick my ass. Even at cards.
